author: JamesWTruher
body: With https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/5080 it is possible to use both `-AsByteStream` and `-Encoding` together. Under these circumstances, `-Encoding` is superfluous as the stream of bytes should represent the bytes in the file (which are not affected by encoding).

comments.author: nityanandagohain
comments.body: Hi, Can anyone help as for how do I work on this, Thanks!

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
For the cmdlet(s) that have this issue, I think the best approach would be to seclude them to distinct parameter sets, preventing them from being used together. 

Depending on existing parameter sets this could get slightly complex, but should be no more complex than adding a series of `[Parameter()]` attributes with appropriate `ParameterSetName` properties; each parameter should be in distinct set(s). Mind that when other sets are present you may need to end up duplicating existing parameter sets to retain other functionality while segregating these two parameters. The important thing is that at least one of the parameters cannot be in the 'default set' (although one could feasibly be to simplify the code).

Give it a shot, and if you need some more detailed instruction just show me where you get stuck and I'm sure I can point you in the right direction. 😄
